I believe for the proof that a tournament graph always has a Hamiltonian path, the case where v loses against every other vertex is missed. This is easy enough to resolve (just add v to the end), but it should probably be mentioned.

When you prove double implications (iff statements) you have to prove them in both directions independently. So first you have to prove that when there exists an Euler tour -> then all vertices have even edges, after that you have to prove that if all vertices have even edges -> then there exists an Euler tour.

陈光 If v is not virtually pecked by u, then v must directly peck all w. Given that v directly pecks u, then v's outdegree must be at least that of u (given that u too directly pecks all w) + 1, so outdeg(v) >= outdeg(u) + 1, because v could also peck others that peck u. But this would imply that u does not have the highest outdegree, hence the contradiction

陈光 First, this guy is true, around 1:11:00 it is a false expression, due to original King chicken problem. To your question, since it's a tournament graph, so for a set W include all chicken except u and v, all chicken can either peck or be pecked by u and v. Assume chicken u has most outdegree, and it NOT a king, so that means v can peck u within two steps(direct or through some chicken in set A, but since if it's not direct then u can peck v so..., it means v can directly peck u) and u can't peck back through somechicken in set W, so there're two subsets of W, A and B, which chicken in A can peck v but they can also peck u, and chicken in B that u can peck but can't peck v. 1.Chicken in B is part of v's outdegree, other two subsets of W are u->C->v, v->D->u, which C doesn't exist otherwise u can peck v, so does D is a part of v's outdegree. 2.So (sizeof(B+D) + 1)=od(v) > (sizeof(B))=od(u)(I think that expression at 1:22:17 is confusion indeed, this should be better), alongside B+D is of course already >= B, which is impossible with the assumption that u has largest degree. 3.Rest of proof is what video already contains so no more to talk now.
